Reviews.Title: “small but affordable, comfy and safe”
Reviews.Author: fostermamabear88
Reviews.Content: we just came back from singapore last night. cant wait to complement the staff of this small hotel chain. Jona, the front desk receptionist went out of her way to lend us change for the bus fare because we only had large bills.as stated it is very small but very clean though. we had a room on the 4th flr with windows that has a pool view of the house behind it. the staff was very accomodating. we asked for 1 extra pillow after midnight without any problem. a bus stop is a step next to it to take you to both Novena and Toa Payoh MRT stations. food court nearby too. hotel prices are very steep in Singapore. glad they came up with clean, affordable and safe budget hotels like this one.. ..what more can you ask?

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel and the room is very clean ^^”
Reviews.Author: bRace_SP
Reviews.Content: one of low budget hotels in singapore... room is very small but very clean too... the location of this budget hotel is perfectooo ^^ cause its near to the bus stop... i think if we only stop for take a rest its gonna be a right choice ^^

Reviews.Title: “A good budgeted hotel”
Reviews.Author: LilDev88
Reviews.Content: New and clean rooms. Nothing to worry about choosing this hotel at all! Only thing is the location, as you'll need to take an 10minutes bus to the closest train station. And when you want to get back to hotel from train station, you'll have to walk 10min to the bus stop across a busy road to catch the bus. Going to the train station is easier, but not going back to the hotel as the walking and the waiting probably gonna take you approx 25min!

Reviews.Title: “Very Low Budget”
Reviews.Author: toscamarie
Reviews.Content: Hotel in Singapore is expensive and due to only stop over for a night, we did not want to spend much on a hotel and decided to get a three star, that turned out to be a very low budget hotel. Location is perfect but in a matter of cleanliness and comfort are way far from a three star rated hotel. Room is very small and shower is attached closely to the toilet, and so when you take shower everything will go wet! Staff is really nice, very attentive to help. Value for money is a bit expensive since we pay for room only, but I doubted they served breakfast since we just found out that the hotel itself is really small.... Will we come back there??? I don't think so....might stay at another hotel...

Reviews.Title: “a very budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Blue T
Reviews.Content: Though not much expensive, this hotel have rooms that are too small! We were staying at Fragrance Hotel - Oasis last 2008 and its too cramped for two (and to think my mum, sister and brother shared a room -- you can just imagine!) So we went and booked again this year (October 2011 -- been accustomed to stay at this place) Since both my mum and sister are staying, we thought we can still handle it. I've checked-in in behalf of my family and we were told to stay at another hotel (Fragrance - Classic) because the aircon needed a repair! We asked if we can be assisted for the transfer and the guy at the receptionist informed a lady employee (wearing only tight leggings and shirt) to help us. We thought she can help us even push just 1 luggage bag but she just said "come". hmmm... The towels are not new; by seeing it I can feel that there were more than some hundred guests that are using it! :( No free access to the internet, even wifi! its 2011 people, "dawn of the new age/year of the internet!" duh!? *But at least they keep the room clean before we come back late.

Reviews.Title: “bloody lousy service”
Reviews.Author: Roland L
Reviews.Content: book 2 rooms for 3 night from 29/8 - 31/8/11 and full payment with credit card. Guess what when we arrived they told us the aircond are faulty and we have to transfer to other outlet which is Fragrance Classic.Imagine with heavy bags you have to walk across the street to distance to the other outlet. I book for this cibai oasis because they got twin bed and now I have to move to the other one only with single queen bed. What is the point filling the email and contact no. if you cant contact me and inform me about the changes. At least let me know and save me for the move around trouble. I've travel all over the world and this is the worst hotel service I ever encounter. Pls stay away from this horrible hotel by all mean

Reviews.Title: “Small and simple space but very clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: mschan07
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on last September with my parents and brother. It took about 20 minutes from Changi Airport to Balestier Road by taxi. You would find the hotel easily, because it's located in the main street. We had 2 rooms in the first floor. It's very small, and the bathroom also had limited space. You can only sleep and take a shower inside the room. What I like about this hotel is the cleanliness of the room and the friendly staff. When you leave the room on the morning, it was dirty and messy, but when you come back at night, it become clean like the first time you check-in. We had enough sleep quality, because the area is rather quite. The staff was very helpful. It's our first time to go to Singapore, so we asked many things about the street, food, or places to visit. They explained patiently with smile. Near the hotel is 7-11, Balestier Plaza, and also Balestier food market, where you can buy cheap food with good taste (about 3-5 SGD). It opens 24 hours, so don't forget to eat there when you stay in this hotel. There is no MRT station around the area, but the bus station is outside the hotel. Easy access to go anywhere in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “new and clean”
Reviews.Author: ania-o
Reviews.Content: New and clean hotel – cleanness is the most important thing for me, extremely small room and bathroom. It not so important if you want to see the city. There is nothing more in the hotel – no breakfast (but a food corner next to the hotel), no internet, far away from metro station (big disadvantage).

Reviews.Title: “Budget stay in clean and tiny room.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravellerFIN
Reviews.Content: -Rooms are VERY tiny about 6m2! -Location is a bit far from everything. -MRT 5min bus ride a way. Bus leaves a front of the hotel. -Expensive WIFI! +photos in internet are similar to the room. +Rooms are new and tidy. +Staff speak good English +24h food court next door. Indian food was really cheap and ok. +Novena shopping centre has nearest MRT and lots of shops as well as free WIFI! +Taxi from airport about 20$. From Novena 6$.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel at all Costs!”
Reviews.Author: kmabello
Reviews.Content: Fragrance Hotel did not have the right reservation details when I arrived, and it was such a hassle to fix it. The person at the reception area was unwilling to help; he did not allow me to access the wireless connection from the lobby (so that I can check the email from my laptop). Instead, I had to go to the internet cafe across the street and have the reservation details printed. It was not a good welcome to Singapore. I would not recommend Fragrance Hotel Oasis, or any other Fragrance Hotel outlets, to travelers. These hotels are where people just have two-hour quickies and leave. You would not want to spend time in this place. I would pay extra not to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Small, Not Very Clean and Zero Extras”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Pepper_719
Reviews.Content: I've have stayed in some pretty scary and dirty hotels--so I have experience with the worst--and this is 2nd worst place I've ever stayed. Super-small rooms. Claustrophobic. The world's worst-designed bathroom. In their goal to pack the most into the smallest place, they forgo normal bathroom planning and just crammed it all in. At least the toilets flush and you don't have to squat. The room has 1 bed and 2 nightstands but only 1 1/2 drawers. The cupboard you think might come in handy? It's the electrical panel for the room. Wet towel? Well, you've got three hooks on the wall. Anything else to hang up? Too bad. And the floor mat in front of the bathroom? Not sure when it was last cleaned, but I'm sure my feet got dirty stepping out of the shower. We had to ask to keep our old towels the next day so we had a clean place to wipe our feet before entering the room. Shower is directly next to toilet bowl -- cannot shower without toilet getting wet. No smoking in the hotel and with no window that opens, no way to cheat (So you have to wait for the world's slowest elevator to step outside.) Instead of bar soap, you get a liquid soap dispenser on the wall for your hair & body. Sheets were torn and not clean--had hairs on them. Pillow cases and sheets had some sort of industrial stain that will probably never come out. Bathroom had mildew along most caulk. The entry way is so cramped you cannot open the bathroom and the door to the room at the same time. No room for luggage. Pillows compress too much and if the hotel is full, no extra pillows available. Hotel not near anything worth seeing. It's close to a bus stop, but if you're taking the MRT to most destinations, the wait for the bus and the trip back and forth becomes tiresome. There are 24-hour food stalls 50 feet from the lobby, so that's very handy for eating anytime. If your world-compatible adapter doesn't fit in the outlet, ask for an outlet adapter. It's a $5 SGD refundable deposit. If you have USA-style plugs, you can plug in the top and bottom so you have 2 plugs for 1 adapter. There are tons of Fragrance Hotels. When reading reviews and booking, be sure which Fragrance it is. Hopefully your stay is short (in this hotel) and you only have overnight bags or backpacks because there is no room for anything else. This is by far the leanest accommodations in which I've ever stayed. If you like this area, look for the Value Hotel on Ballestier--it has better reviews. Just say "No" to the Fragrance Hotel - Oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Short & Sweet”
Reviews.Author: RAJAT_BABBAR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, very nice. The drawbacks are very tiny room, for 2 ppl its ok, but not with 2 suitcases as no place to keep even one suitcase. Location next to bus stop but MRT station 5 bus stop away. For kids its may not be appealing as no restuarant or food items, but just a 20 steps away is 24 hour food court, where lot of Food variety available. Staff very friendly, 100 times better then other fragrance hotel in gelyang street. Try to take fragrance oasis in comparison to fragrance classic. Overall good.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and shiny”
Reviews.Author: BillGChristchurch
Reviews.Content: Being very new everything worked and was presented in first class order. Room would be a bit tight for two people. Shower had plenty of hot water that sprayed over the toilet, mirror basin etc. Leave your towel & cloths outside. My room had a nice outlook to the pool of a modern block of 3 apartments. Bus Stop to CBD handy & food avalable next door.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly an Oasis”
Reviews.Author: southeastasiabound
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fragrance Hotel in December 08 before heading to Malaysia. I arrived to be told that they only had a reservation for my first night. I had written before hand to extend the reservation to 3 nights but they insisted there was no extended reservation and told me I'd have to leave the next day. They said - there were no rooms anywhere in the hotel. The next day in the morning - as I arrived late the night before- and was quite upset about this- I went to the internet cafe- to print out the extended reservation confirmation email and had I not done that I would have been on the hunt for a new hotel after flying 23 hours the next morning after I arrived. They were insistent that there was no such booking but as soon as I gave them the paper - all of a sudden they had a room! Thankfully, I kept the email! The room was sparse and the you hear exactly what is going on in the rooms next to you! I dont even want to describe - what I overheard even with a pillow over my head and ear plugs. I cant comment too highly on this hotel or the location but will say- Singapore is expensive and to be in the better areas/better hotels you will pay! So if you dont mind the confusing bus to get to the downtown core of Singapore- or the less than nice rooms or a possible mix up, then it might be alright for you. The hawker stall next door is cheap and good- and you may need to hit the internet cafe accross the street- as in my case - for the extension letter that I needed to prove in writing that I had booked even though- they confirmed my first nights stay. Less than friendly staff at the hotel, but does that really matter when you are traveling and staying in budget accommodation? You will need to decide. If you can afford more- stay in the Orchard Rd area- much nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Elevator”
Reviews.Author: jazztravel21
Reviews.Content: It was a good deal and was booked with no problem online. I arrived late at night and the room was waiting for me. I got room 601 which was on the top floor next to the elevator room right next to me. There was a constant strong noise coming from there which made it impossible to sleep. It was raining that night you could here the rain banging on my ceiling pretty hard. The room was tiny and not much left around the bed. Could not open the suitcase - only on the bed. I felt I had fleas in the bed and was itching all night. The hotel has no restaurant or place to get something to eat. Its located next to a 24 hour food court which was nice. Other rooms may have been fine but the rooms on the 6th floor are terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: liciece
Reviews.Content: It's a small hotel located in a good place which has a bus stop right close to the door.I always take Bus 21 or 131 to go to the nearest MRT station NOVENA.It only takes me 10 mins. There is a modern hawker stall in the other side and providing lots of delicious foods. Hotel room is small but clean enough.There is no laundry service in the hotel,however you can ask the reception to recommend you some other laundry service.They always are friendly. I think I will go to this hotel again.
